question.text:
Young's moduli of the material of wires A and B are in the ratio of $1: 4$, while its area of cross sections are in the ratio of $1: 3$. If the same amount of load is applied to both the wires, the amount of elongation produced in the wires $\mathrm{A}$ and $B$ will be in the ratio of
[Assume length of wires A and B are same]

solution.text:
Elongation produced in the wire is given b
$\Delta \mathrm{L}=\frac{\mathrm{FL}}{\mathrm{AY}}$
Here, $L=$ length of wire
$A=$ area of cross-section of wire
$\mathrm{Y}=$ Young's moduli of material of wire.
$\because \mathrm{F}$ and $\mathrm{L}$ is same and
$\begin{aligned}
& \frac{\mathrm{Y}_{\mathrm{A}}}{\mathrm{Y}_{\mathrm{B}}}=\frac{1}{4} \quad \text { (given) } \\
& \frac{\mathrm{A}_{\mathrm{A}}}{\mathrm{A}_{\mathrm{B}}}=\frac{1}{3} \quad \text { (given) } \\
& \therefore \frac{\Delta \mathrm{L}_{\mathrm{A}}}{\Delta \mathrm{L}_{\mathrm{B}}}=\frac{\mathrm{A}_{\mathrm{B}}}{\mathrm{A}_{\mathrm{A}}} \frac{\mathrm{Y}_{\mathrm{B}}}{\mathrm{Y}_{\mathrm{A}}}=\frac{3}{1} \times \frac{4}{1}=12
\end{aligned}$
